instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used in the classification of in vivo magnetic resonance images (MRI) of human articular cartilage for development of osteoarthritis (OA)?
Output: T2 maps of cartilage were used in the classification of in vivo magnetic resonance images (MRI) of human articular cartilage for the development of osteoarthritis (OA).

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the classification of in vivo magnetic resonance images (MRI) of human articular cartilage for development of osteoarthritis (OA)?
Output: The spectral feature processing method used in the classification of in vivo MRI images of human articular cartilage for OA development was the weighted neighbor distance using compound hierarchy of algorithms representing morphology (WND-CHRM).

instruction: What metric was chosen and how far can this metric go in the classification of in vivo magnetic resonance images (MRI) of human articular cartilage for development of osteoarthritis (OA)?
Output: The metric chosen for the classification of in vivo MRI images of human articular cartilage for the development of osteoarthritis (OA) was the weighted neighbor distance using compound hierarchy of algorithms representing morphology (WND-CHRM). This metric was able to classify the T-2 maps of cartilage for the progression to symptomatic OA with 75% accuracy.

instruction: What machine learning algorithm was used to classify in vivo magnetic resonance images (MRI) of human articular cartilage for the development of osteoarthritis (OA)?
Output: The machine learning algorithm used to classify the MRI images of human articular cartilage for the development of osteoarthritis (OA) was the weighted neighbor distance using compound hierarchy of algorithms representing morphology (WND-CHRM).

instruction: Can the machine learning algorithm, WND-CHRM, be used to classify in vivo magnetic resonance images (MRI) of human articular cartilage for the development of osteoarthritis (OA) using spectral feature processing methods?
Output: Yes, the machine learning algorithm WND-CHRM can be used to classify in vivo magnetic resonance images (MRI) of human articular cartilage for the development of osteoarthritis (OA) using spectral feature processing methods. The algorithm utilizes T-2 maps derived from the registered images and applies the weighted neighbor distance using compound hierarchy of algorithms representing morphology (WND-CHRM) to classify the T-2 maps for the progression to symptomatic OA.
